sub_topic: Determining the rank of a matrix
message_1:
Consider the following matrix A:
$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
2 & 4 & 6 \\
3 & 6 & 9
\end{bmatrix}
$$
Determine the rank of matrix A.
message_2:
To find the rank of matrix A, we need to perform Gaussian elimination to find the row echelon form of the matrix. Let's perform the row operations:

1. Subtract 2 times the first row from the second row:
$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
0 & 0 & 0 \\
3 & 6 & 9
\end{bmatrix}
$$

2. Subtract 3 times the first row from the third row:
$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
0 & 0 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & 0
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now the matrix is in row echelon form. The rank of a matrix is the number of non-zero rows in its row echelon form. In this case, there is only one non-zero row, so the rank of matrix A is 1.
